result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brandon Robinson

defendant.name: Robinson, Brandon
defendant.address: 16945 N 76th ST Apt 207, Menomonee Falls, WI 53051

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Brandon Robinson in court.  Attorney Ruby De Leon in court for Brandon Robinson.  Prosecuting attorney M Samir Siddique in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a status conference. Defendant needs to complete a TAD evaluation. Defendant may be eligible for a DPA. Case adjourned to Branch 30.
Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for November 29, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Brandon Robinson appeared by video.  Attorney Ruby De Leon appeared by video for Brandon Robinson.  Prosecuting attorney Foley J. Van Lieshout Ms. in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a status conference. Defense is in receipt of discovery. Case may be in DPA posture. 
Case adjourned.
Status conference scheduled for October 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Brandon Robinson in court.  Sarah Dahdouh appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Brandon Robinson appeared by video means.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.  
Indigency hearing proceeded.  Court makes a finding that defendant is indigent.  Court appoints Ruby DeLeon as counsel for defendant at the rate of $100.00 per hour. Defendant shall reimburse Milwaukee County at the rate of $50.00 per month commencing 11/1/2022 until paid in full. Order signed and filed and emailed to defense counsel.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.  Status conference scheduled for September 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Brandon Robinson
Current: 16945 N 76th ST Apt 207, Menomonee Falls, WI 53051   (Effective: 07-20-2022)
Prior: N89W16114 Cleveland Avenue, Menomonee Falls, WI 53051

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Court advised Defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON 07/22/22. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR, A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Defendant Brandon Robinson in court.   Jessica Birmingham, under the student practice rule, appeared with A.D.A. Michelle A. Grasso appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel. Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 30.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 7/20/22 @ 2p
